Description: Fragment of bleached undyed linen cloth of medium quality; two double self-stripes. Edges cut or torn. There is a "Z" symbol in pigment or ink in one corner - unsure if this is ancient or modern. The weave is close and plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun and S-spliced (and where they are not spliced, the threads give the appearance of being double); the stitch gauge is warp c.25 ends per 10mm and weft c.11 picks per 10mm.
